top_categories.workout_context: Grinduro Germany’s eifel volcanic landscape, german forest gravel roads demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Grinduro Germany isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Grinduro Germany rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Grinduro Germany when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Grinduro Germany — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Grinduro Germany’s enduro-style gravel with timed descents and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Grinduro Germany. Make this intensity feel like home.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Grinduro Germany — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on enduro-style gravel with timed descents.
Grinduro Germany’s enduro-style gravel with timed descents drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Grinduro Germany’s 6,562ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Grinduro Germany count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Grinduro Germany’s 6,562ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Grinduro Germany’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Grinduro Germany demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride enduro-style gravel with timed descents at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: eifel volcanic landscape, german forest gravel roads, technical singletrack descents. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 62 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 62 miles of enduro-style gravel with timed descents in Hellenthal, Eifel, Germany.
